intro: Onosmodium bejariense var. occidentale, commonly known as the Western Bejari sandmat, is a rare flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a creeping or ascending stem with alternate leaves that are often lobed or toothed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
